text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition SatuSehatRiskAssessment

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
RiskAssessment 0..*RiskAssessmentPotential outcomes for a subject with likelihood
identifier 0..*IdentifierUnique identifier for the assessment
basedOn 0..1Reference(Resource)Request fulfilled by this assessment
parent 0..1Reference(Resource)Part of this occurrence
status 1..1coderegistered | preliminary | final | amended +
method 0..1CodeableConceptEvaluation mechanism
code 0..1CodeableConceptType of assessment
subject 1..1Reference(Patient | Group)Who/what does assessment apply to?
encounter 0..1Reference(Encounter)Where was assessment performed?
Slices for occurrence[x] 0..1dateTime, PeriodWhen was assessment made?
Slice: Unordered, Open by type:$this
occurrence[x]:occurrenceDateTime 0..1dateTimeWhen was assessment made?
occurrence[x]:occurrencePeriod 0..1PeriodWhen was assessment made?
condition 0..1Reference(Condition)Condition assessed
performer 0..1Reference(Practitioner | PractitionerRole | Device)Who did assessment?
reasonCode 0..*CodeableConceptWhy the assessment was necessary?
reasonReference 0..*Reference(Condition | Observation | DiagnosticReport | DocumentReference)Why the assessment was necessary?
basis 0..*Reference(Resource)Information used in assessment
prediction 0..*BackboneElementOutcome predicted
outcome 0..1CodeableConceptPossible outcome for the subject
Slices for probability[x] 0..1decimal, RangeLikelihood of specified outcome
Slice: Unordered, Open by type:$this
probability[x]:probabilityDecimal 0..1decimalLikelihood of specified outcome
probability[x]:probabilityRange 0..1RangeLikelihood of specified outcome
qualitativeRisk 0..1CodeableConceptLikelihood of specified outcome as a qualitative value
relativeRisk 0..1decimalRelative likelihood
Slices for when[x] 0..1Period, RangeTimeframe or age range
Slice: Unordered, Open by type:$this
when[x]:whenPeriod 0..1PeriodTimeframe or age range
when[x]:whenRange 0..1RangeTimeframe or age range
rationale 0..1stringExplanation of prediction
mitigation 0..1stringHow to reduce risk
note 0..*AnnotationComments on the risk assessment

Documentation for this format

name: SatuSehatRiskAssessment
title: Satu Sehat Risk Assessment
description: Defines the ID Core constraints on the RiskAssessment resource for risk assessments.

element.short: Potential outcomes for a subject with likelihood
element.definition: An assessment of the likely outcome(s) for a patient or other subject as well as the likelihood of each outcome.

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.expression: contained.where((('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $id in f:contained/*/f:id/@value return $contained[not(parent::*/descendant::f:reference/@value=concat('#', $contained/*/id/@value) or descendant::f:reference[@value='#'])]))

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih daftar data mengenai ID internal faskes untuk penilaian risiko. Ini adalah ID resmi yang diterbitkan oleh faskes untuk menandai hasil penilaian risiko pasien, yang setiap datanya direpresentasikan dengan tipe data Identifier.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data permintaan yang dipenuhi oleh penilaian risiko dengan tipe data Reference, yang dapat direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di semua resource yang ada di FHIR. Misalnya penilaian risiko perlu dilakukan dalam rencana perawatan pasien, maka referensi dilakukan terhadap resource CarePlan atau ServiceRequest.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data yang menunjukkan keterkaitan penilaian risiko ini dengan data lain yang lebih luas, dengan tipe data Reference, yang dapat direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di semua resource yang ada di FHIR. Misalnya penilaian risiko ini merupakan bagian dari penilaian yang lebih besar atau sedang berlangsung, maka referensi dilakukan terhadap resource RiskAssessment atau ClinicalImpression.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data status penilaian risiko dengan tipe data code, yang nilainya mengacu pada data terminologi ObservationStatus.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The status of the risk assessment; e.g. preliminary, final, amended, etc.

element.definition: Berisi data algoritma, proses, atau mekanisme yang digunakan untuk melakukan penilaian risiko dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
element.requirements: The method can influence the results of the assessment.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The mechanism or algorithm used to make the assessment; e.g. TIMI, PRISM, Cardiff Type 2 diabetes, etc.

element.definition: Berisi data tipe penilaian risiko dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data individu yang dilakukan penilaian risiko dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Patient | Group, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Patient/{patient-ihs-number}' Dimana isi dari parameter {patient-ihs-number} adalah ID Patient yang didapatkan dari master pasien indeks.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data kunjungan dimana penilaian risiko ini dibuat dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Encounter, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Encounter/{id-resource-Encounter}' Dimana isi dari parameter {id-resource-Encounter} adalah ID Encounter yang didapatkan dari hasil response.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data tanggal dan atau waktu dilakukannya penilaian risiko terhadap pasien.
element.requirements: The assessment results lose validity the more time elapses from when they are first made.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data tanggal dan atau waktu dilakukannya penilaian risiko terhadap pasien dengan tipe data datetime, dengan format yang diperbolehkan YYYY, YYYY-MM, YYYY-MM-DD atau YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+zz:zz.
element.requirements: The assessment results lose validity the more time elapses from when they are first made.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data tanggal dan atau waktu (periode) dilakukannya penilaian risiko terhadap pasien dari dimulai sampai selesai (arrived to finished) dengan tipe data Period.
element.requirements: The assessment results lose validity the more time elapses from when they are first made.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data kondisi atau diagnosis terkait penilaian risiko yang dilakukan, dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Condition.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data siapa yang melakukan penilaian risiko dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Practitioner | PractitionerRole | Device, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Practitioner/{practitioner-ihs-number}' Dimana isi dari parameter {practitioner-ihs-number} adalah ID Nakes yang didapatkan dari master practitioner indeks.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data alasan penilaian risiko dilakukan, dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data alasan penilaian risiko dilakukan, dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Condition | Observation | DiagnosticReport | DocumentReference.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data sumber yang dipertimbangkan dalam penilaian risiko, dengan tipe data Reference, yang dapat direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di semua resource yang ada di FHIR. Misalnya penilaian risiko dilakukan karena pasien memiliki riwayat penyakit keluarga, maka referensi dilakukan terhadap resource FamilyMemberHistory.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data hasil prediksi berdasarkan penilaian risiko yang dilakukan.
element.comment: Multiple repetitions can be used to identify the same type of outcome in different timeframes as well as different types of outcomes.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must be <= 100
constraint.expression: probability is decimal implies (probability as decimal) <= 100

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: Berisi data hasil prediksi dari penilaian risiko yang dilakukan, dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The condition or other outcome; e.g. death, remission, amputation, infection, etc.

element.definition: Berisi data probabilitas dari hasil prediksi penilaian risiko yang dilakukan.
element.comment: If range is used, it represents the lower and upper bounds of certainty; e.g. 40-60%  Decimal values are expressed as percentages as well (max = 100).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
low and high must be percentages, if present
constraint.xpath: (not(f:low) or f:low[f:code/@value='%' and f:system/@value='http://unitsofmeasure.org']) and (not(f:high) or f:high[f:code/@value='%' and f:system/@value='http://unitsofmeasure.org'])

element.definition: Berisi data probabilitas dari hasil prediksi penilaian risiko yang dilakukan, dengan tipe data decimal.
element.comment: If range is used, it represents the lower and upper bounds of certainty; e.g. 40-60%  Decimal values are expressed as percentages as well (max = 100).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
low and high must be percentages, if present
constraint.xpath: (not(f:low) or f:low[f:code/@value='%' and f:system/@value='http://unitsofmeasure.org']) and (not(f:high) or f:high[f:code/@value='%' and f:system/@value='http://unitsofmeasure.org'])

element.definition: Berisi data probabilitas dari hasil prediksi penilaian risiko yang dilakukan, dengan tipe data Range.
element.comment: If range is used, it represents the lower and upper bounds of certainty; e.g. 40-60%  Decimal values are expressed as percentages as well (max = 100).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
low and high must be percentages, if present
constraint.xpath: (not(f:low) or f:low[f:code/@value='%' and f:system/@value='http://unitsofmeasure.org']) and (not(f:high) or f:high[f:code/@value='%' and f:system/@value='http://unitsofmeasure.org'])

element.short: Likelihood of specified outcome as a qualitative value
element.definition: Berisi data hasil prediksi penilaian risiko yang dinyatakan melalui nilai kualitatif dengan tipe data CodeableConcept, yang nilainya dapat mengacu pada data terminologi Risk Probability.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: The likelihood of the occurrence of a specified outcome.

element.definition: Berisi data hasil prediksi penilaian risiko yang dinyatakan melalui nilai relatif terhadap populasi umum, dengan tipe data decimal. Nilai lebih dari 1 menyatakan risiko yang lebih tinggi daripada populasi dan nilai kurang dari 1 menyatakan risiko yang lebih rendah.
element.requirements: Absolute risk is less meaningful than relative risk.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data rentang waktu atau rentang umur di mana hasil prediksi penilaian risiko pasien tersebut berlaku.
element.comment: If not specified, the risk applies "over the subject's lifespan".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data rentang waktu dengan tipe data Period di mana hasil prediksi penilaian risiko pasien tersebut berlaku.
element.comment: If not specified, the risk applies "over the subject's lifespan".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data rentang umur dengan tipe data Range di mana hasil prediksi penilaian risiko pasien tersebut berlaku.
element.comment: If not specified, the risk applies "over the subject's lifespan".

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data informasi tambahan yang menjelaskan dasar dari hasil prediksi penilaian risiko pasien, dengan tipe data string.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data deskripsi dari langkah yang mungkin dibutuhkan untuk mengurangi risiko yang telah dinilai, dengan tipe data string.
element.requirements: One of the main reasons for assessing risks is to identify whether interventional steps are needed to reduce risk.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi data keterangan tambahan mengenai penilaian risiko yang dilakukan, dengan tipe data Annotation.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Berisi satu atau lebih daftar data mengenai ID internal faskes untuk penilaian risiko. Ini adalah ID resmi yang diterbitkan oleh faskes untuk menandai hasil penilaian risiko pasien, yang setiap datanya direpresentasikan dengan tipe data Identifier.

Berisi data permintaan yang dipenuhi oleh penilaian risiko dengan tipe data Reference, yang dapat direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di semua resource yang ada di FHIR. Misalnya penilaian risiko perlu dilakukan dalam rencana perawatan pasien, maka referensi dilakukan terhadap resource CarePlan atau ServiceRequest.

Berisi data yang menunjukkan keterkaitan penilaian risiko ini dengan data lain yang lebih luas, dengan tipe data Reference, yang dapat direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di semua resource yang ada di FHIR. Misalnya penilaian risiko ini merupakan bagian dari penilaian yang lebih besar atau sedang berlangsung, maka referensi dilakukan terhadap resource RiskAssessment atau ClinicalImpression.
Berisi data status penilaian risiko dengan tipe data code, yang nilainya mengacu pada data terminologi ObservationStatus.
Berisi data algoritma, proses, atau mekanisme yang digunakan untuk melakukan penilaian risiko dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
Berisi data tipe penilaian risiko dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.

Berisi data individu yang dilakukan penilaian risiko dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Patient | Group, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Patient/{patient-ihs-number}' Dimana isi dari parameter {patient-ihs-number} adalah ID Patient yang didapatkan dari master pasien indeks.

Berisi data kunjungan dimana penilaian risiko ini dibuat dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Encounter, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Encounter/{id-resource-Encounter}' Dimana isi dari parameter {id-resource-Encounter} adalah ID Encounter yang didapatkan dari hasil response.
Berisi data tanggal dan atau waktu dilakukannya penilaian risiko terhadap pasien.
Berisi data tanggal dan atau waktu dilakukannya penilaian risiko terhadap pasien dengan tipe data datetime, dengan format yang diperbolehkan YYYY, YYYY-MM, YYYY-MM-DD atau YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss+zz:zz.
Berisi data tanggal dan atau waktu (periode) dilakukannya penilaian risiko terhadap pasien dari dimulai sampai selesai (arrived to finished) dengan tipe data Period.
Berisi data kondisi atau diagnosis terkait penilaian risiko yang dilakukan, dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Condition.

Berisi data siapa yang melakukan penilaian risiko dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Practitioner | PractitionerRole | Device, yang nilainya memiliki format: 'Practitioner/{practitioner-ihs-number}' Dimana isi dari parameter {practitioner-ihs-number} adalah ID Nakes yang didapatkan dari master practitioner indeks.
Berisi data alasan penilaian risiko dilakukan, dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
Berisi data alasan penilaian risiko dilakukan, dengan tipe data Reference, yang direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di resource Condition | Observation | DiagnosticReport | DocumentReference.

Berisi data sumber yang dipertimbangkan dalam penilaian risiko, dengan tipe data Reference, yang dapat direferensikan ke data yang tersimpan di semua resource yang ada di FHIR. Misalnya penilaian risiko dilakukan karena pasien memiliki riwayat penyakit keluarga, maka referensi dilakukan terhadap resource FamilyMemberHistory.
Berisi data hasil prediksi berdasarkan penilaian risiko yang dilakukan.
Berisi data hasil prediksi dari penilaian risiko yang dilakukan, dengan tipe data CodeableConcept.
Berisi data probabilitas dari hasil prediksi penilaian risiko yang dilakukan.
Berisi data probabilitas dari hasil prediksi penilaian risiko yang dilakukan, dengan tipe data decimal.
Berisi data probabilitas dari hasil prediksi penilaian risiko yang dilakukan, dengan tipe data Range.
Berisi data hasil prediksi penilaian risiko yang dinyatakan melalui nilai kualitatif dengan tipe data CodeableConcept, yang nilainya dapat mengacu pada data terminologi Risk Probability.

Berisi data hasil prediksi penilaian risiko yang dinyatakan melalui nilai relatif terhadap populasi umum, dengan tipe data decimal. Nilai lebih dari 1 menyatakan risiko yang lebih tinggi daripada populasi dan nilai kurang dari 1 menyatakan risiko yang lebih rendah.
Berisi data rentang waktu atau rentang umur di mana hasil prediksi penilaian risiko pasien tersebut berlaku.
Berisi data rentang waktu dengan tipe data Period di mana hasil prediksi penilaian risiko pasien tersebut berlaku.
Berisi data rentang umur dengan tipe data Range di mana hasil prediksi penilaian risiko pasien tersebut berlaku.
Berisi data informasi tambahan yang menjelaskan dasar dari hasil prediksi penilaian risiko pasien, dengan tipe data string.
Berisi data deskripsi dari langkah yang mungkin dibutuhkan untuk mengurangi risiko yang telah dinilai, dengan tipe data string.
Berisi data keterangan tambahan mengenai penilaian risiko yang dilakukan, dengan tipe data Annotation.
